Name: Standing female
Description: This wooden statuette probably dates from the Ramesside Period and depicts a young woman standing with her feet together and her arms crossed on her chest. She is wearing a white headcloth that is folded at the back and ends in a point. She is wearing a long, white, close-fitting dress knotted by a red ribbon. The piece is one of a pair, the other being in the Museum Szépmüvészeti in Budapest. The two statues depict the goddesses Isis and Nephthys. They may have formed part of a public catafalque used to transport the deceased to the necropolis.
